org.jointheleague.erik.cleverrobot

Class Dashboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • ioio.lib.util.android.IOIOActivity
        • org.jointheleague.erik.cleverrobot.Dashboard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ioio.lib.util.IOIOLooperProvider

    public class Dashboard
extends ioio.lib.util.android.IOIOActivity
    This is the main activity of the iARoC 2015 application.

    This class assumes that there are 3 ultrasonic sensors attached to the iRobot. An instance of the Dashboard class will display the readings of these three sensors.

    There should be no need to modify this class. Modify Pilot instead.

    Author:
    Erik Colban

      • createIOIOLooper

        public ioio.lib.util.IOIOLooper createIOIOLooper()
        Description copied from class: ioio.lib.util.android.IOIOActivity
        Subclasses must either implement this method or its other overload by returning an implementation of IOIOLooper. A dedicated thread will be created for each available IOIO, from which the IOIOLooper's methods will be invoked. null may be returned if the client is not interested to create a thread for this IOIO. In multi-IOIO scenarios, where you want to identify which IOIO the thread is for, consider overriding IOIOActivity.createIOIOLooper(String, Object) instead.
        Overrides:
        createIOIOLooper in class ioio.lib.util.android.IOIOActivity
        Returns:
        An implementation of IOIOLooper, or null to skip.
